definition: to mention/to speak of/to lift/to pick up/to arouse/to raise (a topic, a heavy weight, one's fist, one's spirits etc)
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings
to raise one's spirits/to take courage

sentences.english: We talk about Tang, there is a kind of tooth Buccal Health fragrant feeling.
sentences.chinese: 我们提起唐诗，就有一种齿颊生香的感觉。

sentences.english: I've heard about you from Mr. Li.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经听李先生提起过你。

sentences.english: Apologies for the blizzard of figures, but they are important.
sentences.chinese: 提起这森冷的数字就令人歉然，但直升机真的很重要。

sentences.english: The events of the past who mentioned, once again, to forget you.
sentences.chinese: 这往事谁又曾提起，再一次，忘却你。

sentences.english: I mentioned that this happened in New Jersey, right?
sentences.chinese: 我提起的这事情发生在新泽西，对吧？

sentences.english: But of course she did not mention my name to you.
sentences.chinese: 不过，她当然不会在你面前提起我的名字。

sentences.english: I didn't have the speed at all on the greens.
sentences.chinese: 我根本不能再果岭上提起速度。

sentences.english: Occurs on a pen thread when the cursor leaves the bounds of an element.
sentences.chinese: 当用户将触笔从数字化仪上提起时，在笔线程上发生。

sentences.english: the carrier against whom an action has been brought shall have the right to require the other carrier to join in the proceedings.
sentences.chinese: 被提起诉讼的承运人有权要求另一承运人参加应诉。

sentences.english: Oh, yeah, Ramon mentioned it to me.
sentences.chinese: 噢，是吗，拉蒙对我提起过。

sentences.english: The first time he mentioned her. Gus started to shake his head and laugh.
sentences.chinese: 第一次提起她的时候，盖斯摇着头大笑起来。

sentences.english: Once, I talked with her son. Another time with Paco.
sentences.chinese: 还有一次，我谈到了她的儿子，另一次提起了佩克。

sentences.english: Mr Grant prosecuted him and watched him put to death.
sentences.chinese: Grant先生对他提起公诉并最终看到他被处死。

sentences.english: Then, when he was about 2-years-old, he started talking about a boy named Bobby.
sentences.chinese: 他两岁大的时候，总是提起一个叫博比的小男孩。

sentences.english: Why did you bring that up ? you dumb-ass.
sentences.chinese: 你个蠢货为什么要提起那件事啊？

sentences.english: Mr. Wyburd approached something which might be giving him trouble.
sentences.chinese: 威勃德先生提起一件可能给他带来麻烦的事情。

definition: to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
to talk about/to mention/(preposition) as for
to think of/to call to mind/to anticipate
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
to mention/to raise (a subject)/to bring to sb's attention
to recall/to think of/to call to mind
to mention/to raise (a subject)/to refer to
strange/unfamiliar
presumably/probably/in all likelihood/surely
as for/when it comes to
to evoke/to induce/to call to mind/to pick up with a hook
exception/to be an exception
to be convinced (that sth is true)/to believe/to accept sth as true
to discuss/to talk about
to be forgotten/to fade from memory
to remember/to recall
